case.state: That eager to find out? I guess your curiosity will depend on how soon you can win a round against me...
”The Inventory”, right? Description checks out. Let's begin.
This place isn’t marked on any Federation maps… but it looks about what I expected.
So this is the "Inventory" I've heard of... doesn't look as secretive as I thought it would.
This must be the Inventory, alright. Doesn't look like any modern pub you'd find in Federation territory.
Huh... Look at that. Didn't know I had fans big enough to want to dress up like me.
What in the-? I'm trying to get a scan on her, but my visor's going haywire!
-The heck? This creature looks unlike anything in my database - and my visor's going crazy trying to bioanalyze her!
Huh... should I be expecting Master Hand or Mario to show up at some point, too?
Huh? I wasn't expecting to see you outside of Smash like this.
Well, look who it is. I'm going to have to ask you later how you found this place too.
Look at that... if I didn't know any better, I'd be tempted to ask if this is some kind of Smash reunion fest.
Well, just you wait a bit, Fina. Looks can be deceiving, you know...
...Guess I should just leave it for now. Wonder if there's another way to get an analysis...
Hmm... Well, clearly it's not going to work right now. There's got to be a better way to learn about her...
Oh. There's someone on this planet who's already heard of me? I... wasn't expecting that.
...Really? We're going to play here, of all places?
...Seriously? What kind of exhibitionist do you take me for?
Huh... Did I come here when this place was having one of those "renaissance fairs" or something? Well, never mind - let's play.
Is there a regular "medieval theme" in this place? Well, too late to change now - let's just begin.
A classroom? There's nothing sketchy going on with this place, right? Good.
Weird that a place like this would have a classroom... If there's anything sketchy here, there will be consequences later.
Just don't ask me to break any targets right now - I'm not in the mood.
This'll be an interesting change of pace for once - trying to strip each other down rather than beat each other up.
Heh... just don't expect me to go on you any easier than I usually do.
Interesting... all we need now is another Smash fighter to show up as the dealer.
Looks just about normal enough… guess I can relax a bit.
Alright, I’m down for some cards. Been a while.
Well, if I’m in the right place… time to start making use of my off time.
One’s all I need.
One. Thanks.
Good hand. Can afford to lose one of these, though.
I’ll grab two.
Taking two, dealer.
Two’s fine.
Mm. I’ll need three.
...Three.
It’ll just be three.
Right, I’ll take four.
Swapping out these four.
Yeah… I need four.
Hmph. Give me a new hand.
Shoot… think I’ll change the whole thing up.
Better change out all of them.
...Five.
Guess I'll go with ~cards.text~ more.
Sufficient.
...Yeah, I’m down with this.
No complaints here.
No guarantees… but I’ve got a good feeling about this.
Mm-hm.
Good by me.
Nothing to be disappointed about.
I like my chances with this.
Well then… here's hoping this nets me a victory.
Shame I can’t make any winnings from this. Been a while since my last big job, so I could use an extra cash bonus.
You know, I actually used to play poker quite a bit with some fellow hunters of mine. Not many of them are left, though...
I've seen lots of really nice planets over the years... just wish I could appreciate them more without most of them harboring death traps everywhere.
Alright, maybe this is the stroke of fortune I've been looking for.
Sorry, everyone... you're not going to take me out that easily.
Better have a good plan for your endgame. Too many people just think about short-term plans.
I've figured out my plan for this... have you figured out yours?
Just what I was hoping for... couldn't have come at a better time.
Okay... you're on.
Don't worry - if you beat me here, it'll only be because you've earned it.
I don't like overconfidence... but I'll allow myself some optimism here.
Promising hand... now just to wait and see.
Didn't occur to me until now - I haven't even identified the planet we're currently on...
Hm.
Hell, I still got this.
If there’s one thing hunting’s taught me, sometimes no fortune is good fortune.
Last time I played something like this, I was still collecting regular bounties. Hadn't even heard of a Metroid.
I don’t mind losing… but you’re not going to win easily.
I have to say, it's interesting playing a game like this where we don't really have to hide how good we're doing.
Too late to second-guess now.
Still trying to get used to this place... civilized worlds the Federation hasn't discovered don't come around very often.
Ready whenever the rest of you are.
Fine hand. Just wish it was better right now.
It could go either way... though that's not really a thought I enjoy having on missions.
Hm... the lack of options you have in this game is really starting to hit me.
If I kept my suit, maybe I could've scanned my last cards for better options... actually, no.
I like being able to predict where things are going... which is to say, I don't like this.
Not exactly good… but I can’t call it bad, either.
Not much to do now but wait and see.
You hear all kinds of strange noises when alone on a mission. Creatures in the walls, corrosive lakes bubbling... and the snickering of smartasses that just beat me at poker.
Right. Am I supposed to be panicking over this?
Tch.
I think I know where this is going…
Doesn’t take much foresight to know how this’ll turn out…
"Easy come, easy go," as they say...
Hm. That's a drag.
Great... might as well just toss these in front of my plasma beam.
Yeah... not exactly filled with confidence right now.
Hm... this really isn't my game, huh.
Well, this could be worse. And probably will be.
Wonder if anyone around here would be willing to lend some tips if I do this again...
Misfortune's part of the game, after all... I've just been doing it a bit too much.
...So, anyone with a 7 high?
I like defying odds and all… but I think they’ve got me beat here.
Ugh… I’m up Phazon creek without a suit.
...Hm? What about Jim and I?
...Do you know this girl, Jim?
You don't say, Miku? Didn't realize I was famous even outside of Federation space.
I have, Miku. Typically in dangerous places, but their beauty makes them worth fighting for.
You're close. I'm a bounty hunter - the type of person they send when the space patrol finds a threat bigger than their pay grade.
Thankfully not, Stocking. There's no evidence that ghosts even exist in Federation space... though a certain threat I found on Zebes almost fooled me.
Don't be so quick to assume, Nami. You might end up caught even more off-guard if an actual robot shows up.
Don't take offense, Nami, but your robot detection skills need some more work. There could be other robots here you've overlooked, after all...
A poem? Odd time to ask, but... I won't shoot down your enthusiasm.
...Is there a reason you're not looking at me right now, Tomoko?
I find the catchiest nicknames are just three letters, so... "Kum"? Wait, no...
The closest thing that comes to that for me is Adam, but... we keep things professional.
I do respect your dedication to the costume, friend. Just a shame your dedication to the act stops there.
So, what's your outfit like, ~militarytarget~? Some sort of official government force, or merc group?
Haven't really met many soldiers outside the Federation. I'd hope yours is just as responsible, ~militarytarget~.
It's interesting... sometimes the Federation finds worlds that are also pretty advanced, but their cultures are always so different - like yours, ~futuretarget~.
The place you're from, ~futuretarget~... what's the state of its space travel capabilities? I'd assume at least somewhat active.
...Hm. Guess I'm not the only one who figured my weapon can still be good for something here.
It's nice to see I'm in good company here. Wasn't sure what to expect when I arrived.
I'm glad there's plenty of well-adjusted people here. I don't always get those.
Didn't know if I'd find other proclaimed "heroes" here. I'm pleasantly surprised.
...I have to admit, knowing I'm not the only one here from space makes me feel a bit more welcome.
Funny, I never did picture us meeting like this outside of Smash. Neither you, probably.
Funny - here I thought I'd have the most advanced tech out of anyone until I learned about you.
Your tech certainly sounds impressive... though I'll take my power suit any day.
However good your tech is, don't go bragging about it to any Federation grunts. They'll argue with you all day on it.
Oh, name’s Samus. Bounty hunter. Pleasure’s mine.
My name’s Samus, by the way. Hunter employed by the Federation. Rest of you?
I know what you’re thinking, and yes - I do usually take my armor most places I go. You’ve all got your own things you usually don’t leave home without, right?
Got to say, one of the most uncomfortable things I did by mistake was go on a mission and forget my zero suit - any of you do anything like that?
No matter how far I go, there's always more planets with more life to discover... have any of you made such discoveries?
You know, some people are still surprised when they see me without my armor and find out I’m a woman. Weird, isn't it?
It's strange... to some people, power armor always carries the expectation that a man's inside it. Never got why.
I don't usually go around public places in my Zero Suit, but I typically get stares when I do. I think I'm starting to understand why...
I know my Zero Suit shows off a lot more, but don't let your imagination get too ahead of you, ~player~. Save that for later...
My undergarments show off a lot more skin than the Zero Suit, don't they? Gets me even more stares than I already had...
Some might say the loss of a skin-tight suit is a downgrade. I'd see it as a way to feel someone even closer.
Being a super-athlete means I'm able to stretch my body in all sorts of ways. What do you think of that, ~player~?
Funny. I have yet to get to my top or shorts, and you're still looking pretty hungrily at me, ~player~. Be honest - is it my midriff?
Cute look on your face there, ~player~... though it wouldn't be a shame if it disappeared for a bit between my breasts.
I've figured people probably compare breasts to some degree... but I don't know how much you can really do that beyond personal preference.
Do you usually get flustered this easily, ~player~? That's... pretty cute.
Bit of a shame you never dropped your cards, ~player~ - I was kind of hoping I could see what you look like bending over.
Still got my blaster on-hand... don't think I'll need it, though.
Hmm... Still got a full charge.
Yeah, this place looks pretty safe. Only thing the power armor's good for is another layer.
Guess I can finally drop my guard for once. Nice knowing I don't have to worry about it.
Red suits your face well, ~player~. Mind making it redder?
Normally I don't like leaving myself so exposed... but I'll make an exception for you, ~player~.
Oh yeah, another odd thing about the fan who called me "Metroid" - for some reason they thought I couldn't crawl. Don't know what they were thinking there.
I'm glad I don't have to deal with stressful memories in times like this... except maybe Crocomire's death. Replaying it in my head too much can get disturbing.
It's interesting, seeing all manner of seasoned warriors around here. I wonder how many of them have faced a foe as gigantic as Kraid - or worse.
Funny story - I once met someone who said they were a huge fan of mine. They really did look up to me... Then it turned out they thought my name was "Metroid."
Don't get me wrong, the Federation has good people. But after things like the Phazon harvesting incident, I sometimes wonder if they're more trouble than they're worth.
The terraforming of Norion still fascinates me to think about - how a barren wasteland was turned into a lush forest world. I wonder just how many like it have been changed...
Planet topographies are so interesting - some like Zebes and Arcterra are just comprised of one type, and others like Earth or Bryyo consist of many across their surface.
Federation's been doing a lot to expand its arsenal lately - lately they've been working on these hunter bots they call EMMI. Almost pity whoever they get sent after.
Glad I secured my ship before stepping in here... then again, I've lost so many that I almost don't know why I bother.
I like to be on good terms with other bounty hunters. Not that my standards are very high - just don't end up like "Big-Time" Brannigan.
People sometimes ask me why I work alone. It's not because of ego or anything - my work is just better without clashing methods or motivations.
There was this one bounty hunter - Armstrong Houston - he was a bit too eager to be my partner. Still, he seemed capable. I hope he's still doing well on his own.
Biomorphs are such... nebulous subjects. We have an idea of their "natural" state, but even that could just be a disguise. They could even be hidden in ways we wouldn't expect.
Some bounty hunters are often known for using a certain "affinity weapon". Personally I like staying flexible, and not relying on one weapon too much.
By this point, I don't think the average Federation citizen even knows what a Metroid is. I'd hope so, anyway.
If that's a serious question: Yes, this is armor. In case you don't know, it helps protect you in combat.
I just prefer to know I'm protected whenever I'm in someplace new. Perhaps the notion's lost on someone as bold as you.
When you've been in as many fights as me, you come to prefer the feeling of being well-armored. You should try it sometime.
I don't know what people in your world use, but I don't see any reason to change it. My armor's never failed me.
I've trained to use this armor all my life - don't think there's any reason to stop using it now. There's no problem with that, is there?
Settle down there - I don't know what this "Harvest" is, but I can assure you I'm not one of them.
Relax, Jura. Whatever has you so scared of this "Harvest", you have no reason to fear the same from me.
Is being stoic such a bad thing? You seem strangely fixated on this idea.
Maybe I am, maybe I'm not. You'll just have to play and see, right?
...Heh heh. Sorry, just--- you're not actually the first one to assume I'm a robot of some sort.
...Hahah. Sorry, I don't mean to put you off, Meia; I just find it funny when people assume I'm a robot.
Indeed. As much as meeting other life has changed our world for the better, there's other difficulties it's brought on, too.
Correct. Humanity learned a long time ago that it's not alone in the universe - for both the good and bad that it brings.
It's not standard-issue, no. The Federation's tried replicating its design for its soldiers, but it's still one-of-a-kind.
It might surprise you, Meia, but this suit's the only one of its kind. Federation still tries pretty hard to match the specs, though.
It's complicated, Sucrose. To put it simply, it's a mix between concentrated energy and my own willpower.
My suit's powered by a concentrated energy supply, and my own force of will. There's more to it than that, but the explanation would be pretty long, Sucrose.
Interesting... so you're a fellow bounty hunter, then? I wasn't sure if any independent systems had those.
I see. So... you're also in the bounty hunting business? I didn't think I'd meet another one on a new planet like this.
What's it like? Well, that'd be a pretty long answer. It's most of what I've ever known, after all.
If you want to know what bounty hunting's like, then you'd have to be prepared to listen for a while. It's practically what I was made for.
Perhaps. I just feel most comfortable when I stay focused on what's ahead, Tao - I've always assumed such levity to just get in the way.
I've always assumed not taking my job seriously enough would result in losing focus on the task at hand. Then again, it's not like I've given your theory a try either, Tao.
No need - keeping it clean and functional is second nature to me. I appreciate the offer though, Senko.
Thank you, Senko, but you don't need to worry. Making sure it's well-maintained is as important as any one of my missions.
Don't worry about it, Senko. I don't take offense to it - even if it does get old.
It's fine, Senko. It'd be useless to get mad about it - especially after how many times it's happened.
You're correct, Yuri. I've seen and fought all sorts of dangerous things. Space pirates usually come to mind first, though Metroids come soon after.
There's a lot, Yuri. Between organized monsters like the space pirates and enigmatic creatures like Metroids, there's no shortage of answers I'd have.
Favorite kill? Hmm... I've killed a lot of things over the years. Narrowing it down would take me some time.
Hm, tough question there, Aaravi... When you've been bounty hunting as long as I have, it's hard to weigh everything you've killed against each other.
What exactly are you asking, Monika? If I enjoy bounty hunting, or if I enjoy fighting in general?
So you're asking if I enjoy being their prodigal warrior? Or just in terms of bounty hunting?
Never gave it much thought. The color is superfluous compared to its function.
Haven't considered it. My only concern is how well it serves me in my job.
I read, keep up-to-date on current events when I can. Otherwise I'm keeping my ears open for potential contracts.
I pay attention to what's happening in the Federation, as well as read for fun. Only things I regularly do beyond looking for more work.
"Mecha butler"...?
I come from Federation space, Ganyu. Not something you're familiar with, is it?
I'm from the Federation-controlled sectors, Ganyu. Guessing you haven't heard of those.
It's a one-of-a-kind power suit, Wasp. Designed by the Chozo, many years ago.
The answer to that question's more complicated than you'd probably like, Wasp.
...Hm. Knew I was going to get that question eventually.
...Yeah, saw that question coming.
You're right about that, Monika. I've faced a lot of monsters over the years, and they never get easier.
Considering you're asking me to pick one of the dozens I've faced, and with how dangerous they were... yeah, your prediction's right.
I can't relate to the latter, but I've felt the impact of the former before.
I try not to. My job requires me to be at my peak at all times.
I make sure every part of my body is worked on, Erufuda. You're only as strong as your weakest link, after all.
We all came here to impress, right, Fina? I don't doubt you'll find this pretty impressive.
I'm unfamiliar with these "Youkai". Are they an alien species, or are they native to your world, Reimu?
A robot? You must think of yourself as quite the expert on those, Nami - if you're so certain this isn't just a power suit, that is.
And what makes you so certain this isn't just a powered suit with a person inside, Nami? Unless you've studied many robots before?
I've gotten both assumptions before. The one that I'm a man always confuses me... though I find the robot one pretty amusing.
People are often quick to assume either of those. The robot one is at least understandable - not to mention a bit funny. I don't get why they'd assume I'm a man, though.
Not at all - my Power Suit's perfectly attuned so there's no discomfort when wearing it. In fact, the Zero Suit helps with that.
You don't need to worry. The Zero Suit's designed to increase comfort with the Power Suit. And if it was too cumbersome or taxing to use for a while, I would've found a replacement long ago.
Thankfully, no. Years of practice have allowed me to be just as deft with a single hand as I am with two.
You're right about that, Barbara. Half the time I don't even know what I'm about to be facing, so you can never be too careful.
You notice well, Barbara. It pays to be as prepared as possible, especially when going into new places, where I'm not sure what I'll be facing.
There's been a lot of advancements made in space technology where I come from, Cynthia - even so, this is one-of-a-kind.
You're right, Cynthia. Granted, this is a unique one, but other power suits have come a long way from where we were hundreds of years ago.
It's quite comfortable, Petra. In fact, I wear it because it allows me to be more comfortable while wearing my Power Suit.
If you're concerned about the tightness, Petra, don't be. It's actually designed to give the most comfort possible while wearing my Power Suit.
Research is part of what I do, yes. But I'm not as interested in space itself as I am in the flora and fauna of other planets.
No, actually - I'm interested in research, but moreso in the lifeforms of other planets, rather than the space surrounding them.
Just like to come prepared, Leon. Never want to be caught with your pants down on an unexplored world.
If I keep doing my job well, Leon, then hopefully it'll never get past imagination for you. I'm prepared for just about anything.
It was created by my family. Well... my adoptive family, I mean. They raised me to be the greatest warrior of their kind, likely planning the specs for years.
...Ridley. Without a doubt in my mind.
...Ridley. Can't think of another being more dangerous than him.
Years and years of training each day, Yuno... mixed with some gene splicing along the way.
I'm a bounty hunter, Heris. My armor keeps me safe from all manner of threats - both hostile and environmental.
Correct, Shamir. Don't worry - the armor won't be any trouble.
Trust me, the armor won't be an issue. Actually, it should be one of the easier parts.
Eager, aren't you? Well, it's not something you'd find easily.
Sorry if I curb your enthusiasm, but this suit isn't exactly readily available.
Sigh... Even here, I can't escape people getting my name confused...
Indeed. I often work alongside the Federation, but my tasks in the field are entirely solo.
Correct. I've only got my own equipment and tactics to rely on planetside - even when I'm working with the Federation.
It's technology, alright. Magic's not a thing where I'm from.
It is technology, Shamir. Magic's never existed in my galaxy.
Correct. It displays life signs, biological information, weapon details - on many missions I'd be practically blind without it.
Don't need it. My suit and ship supplies are able to treat any affliction I have, Beatrix.
Really... so you've tested similar apparatuses meant to give compact movement like it?
True - You're probably the only one here who won't be surprised by this, Pit.
I'll assume you mean in general, and not that you've imagined me playing strip poker before... in all seriousness, that's a good way of looking at it, Pit.
I have to agree. Much as we all hang out casually in Smash, sparring is still the main way we compete. Playing in something like this is nice for a change.
An honor? How come? We've known each other for quite a while now, Pit.
Calm down there, Pit. I think everyone else here has had this possibility on their minds.
Got tired of me staying on top? Sorry, that's just usually how I roll.
Well, it had to happen to someone. Might as well be me.
Alright, fair’s fair. Can’t say no to a legitimate win.
Okay, you got me. Suppose this makes it a little more even anyway.
We've all got dues to pay for our actions... all things considered, this isn't so bad.
Don't let this get to your head - a bounty hunter always keeps her cool until she's beaten.
I don't mind losing again... as long as you don't mind losing soon after too.
Enjoy it while it lasts - you might not last much longer.
Well then... looks like my game's about to really begin.
Took you long enough. You want to see me for real, huh?
Guess I'm about to make the game more interesting for you. You're welcome.
Not where I expected to be right now... good thing I keep my plans flexible.
I may not be a people person, but I'm not dense enough to try circumventing the rules.
Hm... maybe if I'd swapped out that other card instead...
Guess I should re-think my play here soon. As for now...
Alright, I'm still well enough ahead... I'm not ready to call it downhill from here.
Eh, I'm used to tough luck anyhow. It pays to be prepared - mentally as much as physically.
Mm... I've got to admit, you have me a little concerned by now.
Huh, looks like I may need to start changing up my plan for real after all...
I'm not one to place my faith in luck, but... wonder if it's starting to pass me by.
Well, we're still on the same playing field, at least. A winning chance is still a chance.
So... you're ready to see me for real?
So, want to take bets on what I'll take off first? Because you're all probably right.
...I hear a couple of you chuckling. I assure you, the humor of this is not lost on me.
Okay, then… might as well enjoy this.
Don’t worry, I’ll play fair. I’m not like those dirty pirates.
You don’t have to beat me that quickly while I’m here, you know. You’ll be seeing my body either way.
Looks like I might be taking a plunge... but it is what it is.
Much as I don't like losing... I'd hate being a poor sport even more.
Huh, guess it's going to be earlier for me than I thought.
I was actually curious as to how long I'd go before taking this off. Guess it wasn't so long after all.
That quick, hm... looks like this'll be a harder game than I thought.
Alright, well... To me, it's more than just a job. It's a way of life. Ever since I was a child, I was raised to be the ultimate warrior of the Chozo, the people who adopted me.
Okay, then... Most see being a bounty hunter as a means to make money. But to me, as someone who was trained by the Chozo to be their prodigy, it's everything.
Saving the universe? Now this is starting to get too relatable... Oh, you might want to stand back a bit.
You've had to save the universe too, huh? Funny... Ah, give me a moment.
Wait... have you faced an evil version of yourself too? As well as a dragon?
...Alright, I could've predicted a dragon, but have you personally faced an evil doppelganger before as well?
Perhaps. But I don't wish to sully the original design I was given. Oh, stand back for a moment...
Maybe. Still, changing how the design was intended could be disrespectful. Ah, stand back...
They entertain well enough, if that's what you're asking. Though I wouldn't call myself a "connoisseur".
Well, they certainly keep me from getting bored. Not that I have a wide knowledge on them or anything.
Well, thank you - I wasn't expecting such flattery so soon. I can tell you about such accomplishments if you'd like... though you might want to stand back for this.
Not quite - the job of a bounty hunter's different. Still, I like to think my actions are as noble as such imagery... Oh, before we continue-
Well, I get to hunt down terrible creatures and make sure they can't hurt anyone anymore. I'd say I'm pretty happy with that.
Well, I get to protect people and they pay me well for it. There's not much to dislike.
Thankfully, no. They were found on an unihabited planet far from civilized ones. Give me a second, by the way...
No, thank goodness. Their homeworld was the barren planet of SR388, far away. Oh, one moment...
There's not much mystery, really. It's actually the largest human society in the galaxy. Ah, pardon me...
Actually, it's not all that mysterious. It happens to be the largest human civilization in known space. Oh, one second...
Let's just chalk it up to cultural differences, then. Oh, speaking of which-
Well, if it bothers you that much, don't worry - it's not going to be on for much longer.
I apologize. It's just that I'm not exactly used to this yet. Even years ago, socializing didn't come as naturally to me.
Sorry, then. I'm still just trying to get accustomed to all this - even beyond the lecherous nature of this place, I feel out of sorts.
It's not a hassle to use, but having it on all the time would be a waste. Speaking of which...
I'm a bit glad to be removing it now, actually. Having it on when I don't need it is just impractical.
A back massage? Huh... you're pretty eager to make up for just a small misunderstanding.
Really? This is definitely the first time someone's offered a back massage after that misunderstanding.
Sure it is. But after how much they prepared me, falling short of that would be disrespectful to their memory.
Actually... Well, I'll just let this part speak for itself, Cynthia.
Well... in that case, I think you'll be surprised, Cynthia.
Don't imagine that'd present an issue my grapple beam couldn't fix. Oh, by the way, one moment...
Alien threats - usually the kind the Federation knows too little about. One second...
You'll have the answer right now, then. Hope it doesn't disappoint...
Don't worry, then. You won't have to look too closely...
...Give me a moment. Maybe you'll start making sense after I get out of this...
No, unfortunately. But my X-Ray Visor does allow me to see through thin material and living tissue.
Well, you're about to see either way, so you might as well enjoy the show.
You'll have to pay attention, then. I don't think you want to miss this.
Well, I've exterminated plenty of creatures that match that description, but I doubt they fit your "youkai" classification. Ah, one moment.
Well, you're in luck - you won't have to deal with one of those now either.
No need to worry, Lux. In a way, my suit is already my squire.
That's... huh. Wasn't expecting someone to get into the spirit of the game so quickly.
It varies. Some of them shouldn't be taken lightly, but others are surprisingly docile. With how many there are, you can't accurately generalize them.
Knowing what I do about Earth, it's not that different. There's just as many dangerous species as there are docile ones. If the galaxy is a grand ecosystem, then Earth is just a part of it.
Shouldn't take long at all. Just give me a moment...
Oh, you'll want to stay back for a moment, Kumatora. Trust me...
If you don't mind, Kumatora, just give me some space...
Wish I could relate, Saki. By the way, stand back...
Hey, it's definitely easier to take off than your garments.
Come on, I'm not the type to fly off the handle easily. I know I might look intimidating, but none of you have to worry.
I see. I'd... never considered that before. In that case, consider me equally honored, Pit.
Go on, Pit, spit it out. You don't have to apologize for playing the game like you're meant to, either.
Well, if you all agreed to do the same when it gets down to you… then I’m fine with this.
Wearing my Power Suit here is a bit overkill, I'll admit. I could probably collapse this entire building with it.
Well, you managed to get one good win on me so far - guess you deserve a proper look.
